Remember to maintain an imperative tone, clear and concise language and to avoid unnecessary explanations as indicated in the instructions.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions **Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** 1. **Coordinate System:** Set up a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0595, 0.0595, 0.0] 2. **Sketch:** Draw a closed loop on a plane defined by the coordinate system consisting of four lines: * Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.631, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.631, 0.0) and ending at (0.631, 0.5357) * Line 3: Starting at (0.631, 0.5357) and ending at (0.0, 0.5357) * Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.5357) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) 3. **Extrusion:** Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.25 units, resulting in a 3D model. Part 2 Instructions **Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and remove a portion of it.** 1. **Coordinate System:** Set up a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0893, 0.0893, 0.25] 2. **Sketch:** Draw a closed loop on a plane defined by the coordinate system consisting of four lines: * Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.5714, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.5714, 0.0) and ending at (0.5714, 0.4762) * Line 3: Starting at (0.5714, 0.4762) and ending at (0.0, 0.4762) * Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.4762) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) 3. **Extrusion:** Subtractively extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.2232 units, removing a portion of the previous 3D model. Part 3 Instructions **Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and add a smaller protrusion to one side.** 1. **Coordinate System:** Set up a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.25] 2. **Sketch:** Draw two closed loops on a plane defined by the coordinate system consisting of lines: * Loop 1: Same as Part 1, Line 1-4 * Loop 2: Starting at (0.0595, 0.0595) and ending at (0.6905, 0.0595), (0.6905, 0.5952), (0.0595, 0.5952), and (0.0595, 0.0595) 3. **Extrusion:** Subtractively extrude the second loop along the normal vector by 0.0298 units, creating a smaller protrusion on one side of the previous 3D model.</description>
